intro: Aethionema longistylum, commonly known as the long-stemmed rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody at the base. Aethionema longistylum is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas.
